thread.title: Paul Ince in contention for return to management as new England Under-21s chief
thread.title_full: Paul Ince in contention for return to management as new England Under-21s chief

author: Darren Lewis
title: Paul Ince in contention for return to management as new England Under-21s chief
text:
The FA wants to talk to Ince about returning to management (Photo: Stu Forster) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Paul Ince is a contender for the England Under-21 job. 
The FA are keen to speak to the former Manchester United and Liverpool midfielder about the post vacated when Gareth Southgate took over the senior team. 
Ince, who saved Macclesfield from relegation and led MK Dons to promotion during his first spell, is also interested in a return to club management. 
He said: “I know that if I do go into another job it would have to be a project where the owner or the chairman has, say, a two-year plan. That would excite me.” England manager Gareth Southgate has left behind the Under-21s job (Photo: Getty Images) 
Ince is alongside Stuart Pearce, Aidy Boothroyd and Steve Cotterill, all of whom are known to be on the FA’s shortlist for to take charge of the Under-21s. 
His extensive experience also takes in spells at Blackburn, Notts County and Blackpool. It is perhaps that breadth of experience that has persuaded the FA to have a chat with him. Like us on Facebook
